title: Hamas Chief Yahya Sinwar Killed In Gaza Strike? "Checking", Says Israel Army
content: The Israeli military said on Thursday that it was checking the possibility that it has killed Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar following an operation in the Gaza Strip that it said had targeted three militants.
summary: The Israeli military said on Thursday that it was checking the possibility that it has killed Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar following an operation in the Gaza Strip that it said had targeted three militants.

title: India-Canada Ties Hit Record Low, All You Need To Know About Justin Trudeau
content: This diplomatic row stems from Justin Trudeau's earlier accusations linking Indian agents to the 2023 murder of Khalistani leader Hardeep Singh Nijjar
summary: This diplomatic row stems from Justin Trudeau's earlier accusations linking Indian agents to the 2023 murder of Khalistani leader Hardeep Singh Nijjar

title: "God's Problem Now": US Man's Hilarious Obituary For His Father Goes Viral
content: An obituary for a 74-year-old US man who died after falling and hitting his head has gone viral, with his son letting the public know that he is "God's problem now".
summary: An obituary for a 74-year-old US man who died after falling and hitting his head has gone viral, with his son letting the public know that he is "God's problem now".

title: Atleast 28 Killed After Israeli Strike Hits School, Says Gaza Ministry
content: At least 19 Palestinians including children were killed on Thursday after an Israeli strike hit a school in Jabalia in the northern Gaza Strip that is sheltering displaced people, a Gaza health ministry official told Reuters.
summary: At least 19 Palestinians including children were killed on Thursday after an Israeli strike hit a school in Jabalia in the northern Gaza Strip that is sheltering displaced people, a Gaza health ministry official told Reuters.

title: Man Named In Terrorist Pannun Case No Longer Government Employee: India
content: India has confirmed the US' assertion that a person identified as 'CC1' in a US Department of Justice indictment on an alleged assassination plot of Khalistani terrorist Gurpatwant Singh Pannun is no longer employed by the Indian government.
summary: India has confirmed the US' assertion that a person identified as 'CC1' in a US Department of Justice indictment on an alleged assassination plot of Khalistani terrorist Gurpatwant Singh Pannun is no longer employed by the Indian government.

title: "Wanted Canada To Extradite Bishnoi Gang Members": India On Diplomatic Row
content: In the backdrop of ongoing diplomatic tensions between India and Canada, India has raised concerns over Canada's handling of criminals linked to organised crime.
summary: In the backdrop of ongoing diplomatic tensions between India and Canada, India has raised concerns over Canada's handling of criminals linked to organised crime.

title: Meta Fires Employees For Using $25 Meal Credits On Toothpaste, Detergent
content: The misuse of these benefits, which included sending meals home when employees weren't in the office, resulted in a formal HR investigation and subsequent firings.
summary: The misuse of these benefits, which included sending meals home when employees weren't in the office, resulted in a formal HR investigation and subsequent firings.

title: Italy Makes It Illegal To Seek Surrogacy Abroad
content: Italy's parliament made it illegal on Wednesday for couples to go abroad to have a baby via surrogacy -- a pet project of Prime Minister's Giorgia Meloni party which activists say is meant to target same-sex partners.
summary: Italy's parliament made it illegal on Wednesday for couples to go abroad to have a baby via surrogacy -- a pet project of Prime Minister's Giorgia Meloni party which activists say is meant to target same-sex partners.

title: "Massive Door" Spotted In Antarctica Sparks Theories. What Scientists Say
content: Eagle-eyed users on Reddit first spotted the mysterious structure on Google Maps at the coordinates 69°00’50″S 39°36’22″E.
summary: Eagle-eyed users on Reddit first spotted the mysterious structure on Google Maps at the coordinates 69°00’50″S 39°36’22″E.

title: China's Hackers And Celebrities Fuel Taiwan Pressure Campaign: Report
content: In addition to military pressure, China is reportedly using hackers and celebrities to undermine Taiwan's commitment to self-rule.
summary: In addition to military pressure, China is reportedly using hackers and celebrities to undermine Taiwan's commitment to self-rule.

title: Rapper Diddy Raped Woman As "Payback" Over Tupac Shakur Murder Claims
content: Music mogul Sean "Diddy" Combs, who is in federal custody following multiple charges of racketeering and sex trafficking, has now been accused of raping a woman as "payback" after she suggested his involvement in rapper Tupac Shakur's murder.
summary: Music mogul Sean "Diddy" Combs, who is in federal custody following multiple charges of racketeering and sex trafficking, has now been accused of raping a woman as "payback" after she suggested his involvement in rapper Tupac Shakur's murder.

title: Opinion: Jaishankar Makes It Clear: Pakistan Is Now Just A Sideshow For India
content: For the Modi government, there is neither any incentive nor any interlocutor on the other side to merit a change in its approach.
summary: For the Modi government, there is neither any incentive nor any interlocutor on the other side to merit a change in its approach.

title: 2 Mumbai-Bound International Flights Receive Bomb Threats
content: The pattern of domestic airlines receiving bomb threats to their flights continued for the fourth day as two international flights, one each of Vistara and IndiGo, were targeted similarly on Thursday.
summary: The pattern of domestic airlines receiving bomb threats to their flights continued for the fourth day as two international flights, one each of Vistara and IndiGo, were targeted similarly on Thursday.

title: "Inaccurate Reports": Centre On Cricket Coming Up In S Jaishankar's Pak Visit
content: The Centre rejected reports on cricket featuring in talks between External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar and his Pakistani counterpart Ishaq Dar in Islamabad.
summary: The Centre rejected reports on cricket featuring in talks between External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar and his Pakistani counterpart Ishaq Dar in Islamabad.

title: Bangladesh Court Orders Arrest Warrant For Ex-Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina
content: A Bangladeshi court on Thursday ordered an arrest warrant for exiled ex-leader Sheikh Hasina, who fled to India in August after she was toppled from power by a student-led revolution.
summary: A Bangladeshi court on Thursday ordered an arrest warrant for exiled ex-leader Sheikh Hasina, who fled to India in August after she was toppled from power by a student-led revolution.

title: "Saying What Was Reported": Trump Stands By Claims Of Immigrants Eating Pets
content: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump on Wednesday stood by debunked claims that immigrants in Ohio were eating pets, telling Latino voters during a town hall he was "just saying what was reported."
summary: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump on Wednesday stood by debunked claims that immigrants in Ohio were eating pets, telling Latino voters during a town hall he was "just saying what was reported."

title: Texas Man With Autism Faces Death Penalty Due To Alleged Child Murder
content: The Texas pardons board rejected a clemency appeal on Wednesday from an autistic man on death row whose murder conviction was based on what his lawyers say was a misdiagnosis of "shaken baby syndrome."
summary: The Texas pardons board rejected a clemency appeal on Wednesday from an autistic man on death row whose murder conviction was based on what his lawyers say was a misdiagnosis of "shaken baby syndrome."

title: In A First, US Uses Advanced B-2 Stealth Bombers Against Houthis In Yemen
content: The United States launched a series of airstrikes on Wednesday evening targeting key underground weapons storage facilities controlled by Iran-backed Houthi rebels in Yemen.
summary: The United States launched a series of airstrikes on Wednesday evening targeting key underground weapons storage facilities controlled by Iran-backed Houthi rebels in Yemen.

title: UN Report Says 1.1 Billion People In Acute Poverty
content: More than one billion people are living in acute poverty across the globe, a UN Development Program report said, with children accounting for over half of those affected.
summary: More than one billion people are living in acute poverty across the globe, a UN Development Program report said, with children accounting for over half of those affected.

title: WHO Urges Israel To Allow Aid Access To Gaza Amid Humanitarian Crisis
content: Amid the chaos, WHO and its partners launched the second round of a polio vaccination campaign on Monday, aiming to immunise over half a million children, Xinhua news agency reported.
summary: Amid the chaos, WHO and its partners launched the second round of a polio vaccination campaign on Monday, aiming to immunise over half a million children, Xinhua news agency reported.
